caption:
This photograph features a prominent informational sign on the right, set against a coastal beach scene. The sign has a striking design with a yellow background and black text, featuring the message "YES! ENJOY SOUTH BEACH" in bold uppercase letters. Below this is a subtitled "New York City Department of Parks" in smaller font size. Additional instructions on the sign note that "Swimming is permitted only when lifeguards are on duty 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.", alongside encouragements for cleanliness and safety regarding lightning storms.

The background of the image displays a wide stretch of sandy beach leading up to a calm sea. The beach is relatively empty with only a few distant figures spread out; they are almost indistinguishable due to the distance. The sky is a hazy blue with some clouds, suggesting it could be a warm and somewhat overcast day. On the left side of the image is visible a large, unidentifiable building near the shore, adding a contrasting element of urban development to the natural seaside environment. The whole scene conveys a sense of quiet leisure, emphasizing the recreational use of the location highlighted in the sign.
title: South Beach, Staten Island, is safe for swimming.
